flammable_solids.rationale: Based on the description as Not conbustible (ICSC (2001)) and Not flammable (Weiss, 2nd (1985)), it was classified as out of Category.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Not classified because of "Not conbustible" (ICSC, 2001) and "Not flammable" (Weiss, 2nd, 1985)

self_heating_substances.rationale: Not classified because it is not conbustible(ICSC, 2001) and not flammable(Weiss, 2nd, 1985)

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Containing no oxygen , chlorine and fluorine.

organic_peroxides.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with peroxide present in the molecule.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available. The active ingredient is corrosive to metals.(HSDB, 2005)

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: It was set as Category 3 based on LD50= 214mg/kg of oral administration in rats (Agricultural-Chemicals abstracts (1993)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Since death was not observed in 2000mg/kg in rats dermal administration test (Agricultural-Chemicals abstracts (1993)), it was set as outside of Category.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: In primary skin irritation test using rats, erythema was seen after the first application, and the applied part of skin epithelium and sloughing were seen after the second application. It recovered ten days after the third application, and new tissue was found regenerating at the applied part of the skin. Since diquat was considered to cause a mild irritation to the rat skin (Agricultural-Chemicals abstracts (1985)), it was classified as Category 2.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Although the Draize score in the primary eye irritation examination with a rabbit was 8 for second day, since it was set to 2 seven days afterward and had recovered mostly after that (Agricultural-Chemicals abstracts (1985)), it was referred to as Category2A.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Category1
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: (Respiratory sensitization)-; (Skin sensitization)May cause allergic skin reaction
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitization: No data Skin sensitization: Classified as Category 1 because positive results (31% of positive rate) were obtained (agrochemical abstract (2004)) in the skin sensitization test using guinea pigs.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the negative results in the in vivo micronucleus test using mouse somatic cells (Agricultural-Chemicals abstracts (2004)) and in the in vivo chromosome aberration test using mouse somatic cells (Agricultural-Chemicals abstracts (1989)), we regarded the substance as outside the categories.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Since it was classified into A4 by ACGIH, it was set as the outside of Category. The carcinogenicity test results with rat and mouse (Agricultural-Chemicals abstracts (1985)) is also endorsing this classification.

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Since effects on reproductive function or fertility property are not observed in three generations of rat reproduction study(Agricultural-Chemicals abstracts (1977)) and bad effect to development of neonatal was not observed in a rat teratogenicity studies (Agricultural-Chemicals abstracts (1989)) or in a rabbit teratogenicity study (Agricultural-Chemicals abstracts (1985)), they were considered as on the outside of Categry.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: An acute neurotoxicity study in rats showed no neurotoxicity, but diarrhea, piloerection, urinary incontinence, upward curvature of the spine, tiptoe gait, opisthotonus and motor suppression were observed in females which had been given 150mg/kg of the substance (equivalent to the guidance value for Category 1) (Agricultural Chemical Abstracts, (2004)). So the substance was classified as Category 1 (systemic toxicity).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (eye) through prolonged or repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Since the cataract was observed in the oral repeated administration toxicology studies in rat for 90 days (correspond at 400 ppm (male : 32.4, female : 38.5mg/kg/day, correspond to a guidance value of Category 2 ) (Agricultural Chemicals abstracts (2004)), it was classified into Category 2 (eye).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: it was classified into Category 1 from the 96-hour ErC50=19microg diquat ion /L of algae (Green algae)(Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2003) .

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1, since acute toxicity was Category 1, not rapidly degrading (BOD: 0% (existing chemical safety inspections data)), though less bioaccumulative (BCF=1.4 (existing chemical safety inspections data)).
